extraction_metadata.notes: Complete trial record with detailed interrogations. Accused confessed without torture. Trial notable for: (1) extensive pattern of animal maleficia following economic disputes over horses/ploughing; (2) accused's mother already had witch reputation; (3) multiple prior legal actions for defamation showing accused attempted to defend reputation; (4) sudden confession during interrogation; (5) detailed confession about devil pact, sabbat attendance, and use of black/grey powders; (6) economic stress (debt) as factor in devil's seduction; (7) most harms involved horses in agricultural disputes. Trial shows intersection of economic cooperation failures, reputation defense through legal system, and eventual conviction based on confession.
